intro: Sugerokia nipponica, commonly known as the Japanese sugared plant, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate appearance. Sugerokia nipponica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
